New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his career-high 47th homer, the first of four long balls in the inning
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani sparked a five-run, six-hit first inning in which Edman, Will Smith, and Muncy hit back-to-back-to-back homers
Bobby Miller gave up six runs and five hits, including two homers, while walking four and striking out two in 4-1/3 innings
Teoscar Hernández singled with two out in the eighth, and Edman's second homer gave the Dodgers two huge insurance runs and a 10-7 lead
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts said, 'I saw a lot of fight. It's been a while since I've felt the energy, the buzz in the dugout that we had in that first inning.'
Shohei Ohtani might be gaining the upper hand in a spirited battle with New York Mets shortstop Francisco Lindor for the NL most valuable player award
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers avoided a three-game sweep, pushed their National League West lead to five games over Arizona and 5½ over San Diego, and reduced their magic number to clinch the division title to 12 with 16 games to play
Shohei Ohtani walked and stole his 48th base in the second, continuing his march toward baseball's first 50-50 season
The Dodgers took an 8-7 lead in the seventh when Smith hit a one-out double to right-center and took third on Muncy's groundout
